issue.title: [CF 855] ElvUI Timer Text Broken
issue.body:
This might be an issue regarding ElvUI itself. I heard it broke with WA too, and noticed issues with it ingame as well.

Heads up, either way, if they fix it and they change something.


> Posted by CurseForge user Jalopyy | Imported from CurseForge issue #855 | Raw

comments.body:
Made a ticket about it at http://www.tukui.org/tickets/elvui/index.php?page=bug_show&bug_id=321 . If they update it with a fix or something, might be useful if you have to rescramble some code or whatnot.


> Posted by CurseForge user Jalopyy

According to ElvUI ticket, adding back Elv's timer text won't be possible since the skin itself isn't yet supported by ElvUI Addonskins. So I'm unsure if this feature will just be depreciated until it will be filled (it's on his todo list, so that's something).


> Posted by CurseForge user Jalopyy

TellMeWhen doesn't actually interact with ElvUI. ElvUI hooks into the cooldown sweep code and creates a timer on top of the cooldown sweep whenever a cooldown starts. The option in TMW to enable/disable the elvUI timer actually just sets a single variable that disables the timer when the setting is unchecked. When the setting is checked, it is as if nothing had ever happened. It is up to ElvUI to make its timers work when the setting is checked (enabled) in TellMeWhen.

OmniCC works in the exact same way except for the fact that OmniCC allows the timer text to still be shown when the cooldown sweep is hidden. It just uses a different variable than the one used by ElvUI which is why it is possible to have separate settings for the two addons.

TL;DR - not an issue on TMW's end. Thanks for letting me know about it, though, since I'm sure there will be other people reporting the same issue in the coming days.

Edited Sep 10, 2013

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

I have added some code in 6.2.5 that will make ElvUI aware of TellMeWhen's timers.
